title: Samson’s Riddle and Revenge
summary: Judges 14 tells of Samson’s desire to marry a Philistine woman, against his parents’ advice. He kills a lion, later eats honey from its carcass, and proposes a riddle during his wedding feast. When his wife is coerced into revealing the answer, Samson kills 30 men in anger.

faq.question: Why did Samson want to marry a Philistine woman?
faq.answer: Although it displeased his parents, it was part of God’s plan to confront the Philistines.

faq.question: What was the result of the riddle challenge?
faq.answer: Samson lost the wager and killed 30 men to pay the price, then left in anger.
